title: Teriyaki Rib Eye Steaks Recipe
description: Tangy homemade teriyaki sauce perfectly complements rich ribeye steaks. Colorful vegetable fried rice makes a wonderful accompaniment.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Japanese Teriyaki Rib Eye Steaks 4.6 (100) 66 Reviews 8 Photos Great Japanese teriyaki-style marinated ribeye steak with a from-scratch teriyaki sauce. Submitted by Agent48 Updated on August 2, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 25 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 2 tablespoons soy sauce 2 tablespoons water 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 ½ teaspoons honey 1 ½ teaspoons Worcestershire sauce 1 ¼ teaspoons distilled white vinegar 1 teaspoon olive oil ¼ teaspoon onion powder ¼ teaspoon garlic powder ⅛ teaspoon ground ginger 2 (6 ounce) lean beef rib eye steaks Directions Whisk soy sauce, water, sugar, honey, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, olive oil, onion powder, garlic powder, and ground ginger together in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Pierce steaks several times with a fork. Add steaks to bowl; toss to evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator at least 2 hours. Cook steaks in a hot skillet, wok, or hibachi over medium heat, 7 minutes per side for medium. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 140 degrees F (60 degrees C). I Made It Print 136 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Teriyaki Rib Eye Steaks 01 of 08 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 08 Photo by  Barb Ripley 08/13/2021 03 of 08 Photo by  Maria Quintana 11/11/2019 04 of 08 Photo by  Courtney 08/03/2019 05 of 08 Photo by  Shenelle Thompson 06/07/2015 06 of 08 Photo by  wayne 05/13/2015 07 of 08 Photo by  Diana71 09/25/2011 Great recipe - the teriyaki taste was very pronounced. I thought it was a little on the sweet side so next time I will lessen the amount of sugar used. Grilled perfectly, though, and looked incredibly appetizing! name: Agent48
instructions: Whisk soy sauce, water, sugar, honey, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, olive oil, onion powder, garlic powder, and ground ginger together in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Pierce steaks several times with a fork. Add steaks to bowl; toss to evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator at least 2 hours.;Cook steaks in a hot skillet, wok, or hibachi over medium heat, 7 minutes per side for medium. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 140 degrees F (60 degrees C).
